alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 19 at 9:55AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of eastern Virginia and southeast Virginia, including the following areas, in eastern Virginia, Northampton. In southeast Virginia, Chesapeake, Hampton/Poquoson, Isle of Wight, Newport News, Norfolk/Portsmouth, Suffolk, Virginia Beach, and York. * Through this evening * WHEN...From Noon EDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are forecast, with locally higher amounts possible where thunderstorms are more persistent. These totals may result in instances of flash flooding, particularly in flood-prone, urban or low- lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Chesapeake; Hampton, Poquoson; Isle of Wight; Newport News; Virginia Beach
